Key Match Events: The Nets lost to the Nuggets 124-105
Pre-Game Insights: Jordi Fernandez has known Nuggets coach Michael Malone since their days in Cleveland, and he spent six seasons as an assistant under him in Denver.
Fernandez credits those years for not only getting him the Nets job but laying down the blueprint he’s trying to follow.
Fernandez has a no-excuses culture, 'Once you’re doing your job, there’s no friends.'
Post-Match Reflections: Fernandez said before Friday’s 124-105 loss at Ball Arena. 'Six years of my life with my family were here, my kids were born here, so great memories, not just professionally but family-wise.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ben Simmons, who scored 10 points and had seven assists, and Day’Ron Sharpe (seven points, five rebounds) returned to the court Friday.
Cam Johnson (right ankle sprain) and D’Angelo Russell (right shin contusion) were out and are considered day-to-day.
Trendon Watford (left hamstring strain) most likely won’t play until the Nets return home.
